metadata.titel_preek: Wer hat dich so geschlagen? Ein Passionsgottesdienst

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ongoing crucifixion of Christ in the suffering of the poor and the systemic violence of the world, where the hearer is confronted with their complicity.

subject.identificatie: The 'I' (Hearer/Humanity) as the perpetrator of violence.
tekstueel_bewijs: ICH. Ich habe dich geschlagen, Jesus.
Ich unterstützte das wirtschaftliche System, das Folter braucht.

object.identificatie: The suffering/death of Jesus (and by extension, the poor).
tekstueel_bewijs: Wer hat dich so geschlagen, mein Heil?
die weitergehende Kreuzigung Jesu in unserer Welt sehen.
Gott fragt uns in Christi Tod: Wie weit wirst du dich auf mich einlassen?

ontvanger.identificatie: The Poor / The Victims of the system.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject (Perpetrator/Spectator).

helper.rol_van_god: God is the one being helped/suffering, not the Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: Absent as a power-source; present as a 'fire' to be entered.

tegenstander.identificatie: The System / The 'Spirit of Victory' / Global Capitalism.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is an all-encompassing global structure of 'Profit and Death'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The call to 'become the fire' and stand with the poor.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: After recognizing complicity (Program 1), the hearer is invited to change sides (Program 2).

voorbeelden_god_subject: Gott trennt sich nicht von der Liebe.
Gott fragt uns in Christi Tod.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Wir haben die Partizipation an der Macht gewählt.

voorbeelden: muss den Geist des Sieges austreiben
Wie weit wirst du mit mir gehen?
Wer immer die Wahrheit selbst haben will

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Will' and 'Desire' of the hearer to stop participating in the system. It lacks the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of the Spirit, leaving the hearer in a state of existential demand.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Winners) to Not-S1 (Skeptics) to S1 (Truth in suffering).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in 'doing the truth' by joining the side of the losers.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 (Power) is seen as the demonic structure of the world.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using the Passion narrative, the 'engine' is anthropocentric. The focus is on human guilt (complicity in global systems) and human decision to change sides. God is the passive victim, not the active Savior.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Human as Subject of the Passion

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Gott trennt sich nicht von der Liebe.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Contemporary activists (Mutlangen, Greenham Common) are used as the true subjects of freedom to be emulated.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God in Christ conquers the powers that hold us captive to the system, enabling a life we cannot choose on our own.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Guilt and existential pressure to act.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is reduced to political/ethical alignment.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative is highly coherent but consistently places the burden of action on the human subject.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'It is finished' and the demand 'How far will you go?'

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Christus beweist nichts. Er schweigt... Wer aus der Wahrheit ist, der hört meine Stimme.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon assumes the hearer has the 'Vouloir' (Will) but needs to be shocked into 'Savoir' (Knowing) their guilt.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is systemic complicity in capitalism and violence.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Law' sermon (Second Use of the Law) that exposes sin but fails to provide the 'Gospel' (God as Subject of salvation).

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The human 'I' is the only active force; God is the one being beaten.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God as the one who breaks the power of the system from within.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'I beat you,' use 'You allowed yourself to be beaten to break the cycle of my violence.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on Christ's 'It is finished' as a gift for the complicit, not just a description of his suffering.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that the Spirit gives the power to resist, which we lack.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (System) is already very strong.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon correctly identifies the 'Heavy Opponent'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God saves us from the system) → Ethics (Therefore we resist).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically brilliant and prophetically sharp, but structurally moralistic because it leaves the hearer as the primary actor in the drama of redemption.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is powerful; semiotically, it is a burden.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis is used to support a pre-defined political-ethical framework.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the 'Jesus-talk', the 'God-actant' is paralyzed/passive.
